law.text:
Subject to the limitations of any law that governs the activities of other units of the Executive Branch of the State government, the Special Secretary shall:
advise the Governor on:
the activities of the State government that are intended to promote the employment of minority persons in the State; and
each other matter that affects the rights and interests of minority persons and the communities in which they live; and
as authorized by the Governor:
provide help to minority persons and the communities in which they live;
represent the Governor in any matter that relates to minority persons or generally to the promotion of equality among the people of the State; and
perform any other responsibility that the Governor assigns.
